channel.title: Comments on: A South African at Burning Man

item.title: By: A guide to surviving AfrikaBurn - Duff's Suitcase
item.dc:creator: A guide to surviving AfrikaBurn - Duff's Suitcase
item.description: […] I’ve had some emails from Americans who’ve been to Burning Man several times and are attending AfrikaBurn for the first time this year and want to know how different it is to the US festival (read more about my experience of Burning Man 2014 here). […]
item.content:encoded: […] I’ve had some emails from Americans who’ve been to Burning Man several times and are attending AfrikaBurn for the first time this year and want to know how different it is to the US festival (read more about my experience of Burning Man 2014 here). […]

item.title: By: Road tripping the USA - Duff's Suitcase
item.dc:creator: Road tripping the USA - Duff's Suitcase
item.description: […] smoke ganja” Â and billboards advertising everything tech. The end of the trip was a week at Burning Man – a gathering of 70 000 people in the Nevada desert that defies a simple description. More […]

item.title: By: Sarah
item.dc:creator: Sarah
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/south-african-burning-man/#comment-27100">Amanda</a>.
Thanks Amanda! Burning Man is something everyone should experience. The world would be a better place if everyone went to Black Rock City at least once :)
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Amanda.

Thanks Amanda! Burning Man is something everyone should experience. The world would be a better place if everyone went to Black Rock City at least once ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Amanda
item.dc:creator: Amanda
item.description: Wow, I want to experience this. Incredible article Sarah, loved every word and every pixel.
item.content:encoded: Wow, I want to experience this. Incredible article Sarah, loved every word and every pixel.

item.title: By: Sarah Duff
item.dc:creator: Sarah Duff
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/south-african-burning-man/#comment-27038">Garth</a>.
BM is an expensive mission from South Africa but it's worth every cent. Definitely something to save up for :)
